name: Problems of human rights implementation in Latvia (Minority language rights in the European Union) (JurZ5034)
Humanities/ Sociology/ Psychology (Filz1029)
content:
The Humanities, Sociology and Psychology course provides students with the knowledge, understanding and practical skills that are essential for the development of a person's personality and building healthy relationships with others. 
Within the course, students will gain theoretical and practical insight into such topics as psychological theories, social groups and processes, learning habits, psychology of groups and teams, emotional intelligence, motivation, organizational culture and climate. Students will gain in-depth knowledge of various theories of individual psychology and how they affect human thinking, behavior in the work environment, motivational challenges and the latest trends, social phenomena in groups, internal organizational processes and phenomena. 
As part of the course, learners will gain practical knowledge in the topics of emotional intelligence - knowing and feeling oneself, the ability to manage oneself, empathy and building relationships. By using different teaching/learning methods in the study process, students' basic competencies will be developed: analyze and evaluate information, make independent decisions, communicate and work in groups. The goal is to acquire in-depth understanding and practical skills in humanities, sociology and psychology, which will contribute to a person's ability to know, feel and lead themselves and others.
Teacher: Iveta Graudiņa

name: Algoritmi un datu struktūra/ Algorithms and data structures
Angļu valoda (Valo1327) - Būvniecība
content:
The aim of the study course is to raise students’ level of English language, improve their knowledge in the field of English grammar and stylistics, which enables students to use  academic writing style in their professional activities. Within the study course students learn profession-related terms, learn how to use these terms both in oral and written communication. Language skills are improved by reading and analysing various texts, by watching different video materials, by discussing issues topical in the field of building/construction and by providing solutions to possible problem situations. Students enhance their writing, reading, speaking and listening skills, develop critical thinking and ability to justify their opinion in English in written and oral form.

name: Elektrotehnika un elektronikas pamati (ETeh1002; ETeh2001, ETel1003)
Ener1001 Termodinamika un siltumtehnika
content:
Studiju kursa mērķis: dot pamatzināšanas termodinamikā un siltumtehnikā, kas ļautu saprast visdažādāko siltuma iekārtu darbības principus un veikt termodinamisko procesu, ūdens tvaika, mitra gaisa, ēku siltuma zudumu, plakanu un cilindrisku virsmu siltumatdeves, kaltēšanas iekārtu un siltumapmaiņas aparātu aprēķinus, lai iegūtās zināšanas, prasmes un kompetences varētu izmantot iekārtu projektēšanā, uzstādīšanā, ekspluatācijā, apkopju un remontu veikšanā. 
Anotācija: Kursā tiek apskatīti termodinamikas pamatjēdzieni un pamatlikumi, termodinamiskās diagrammas un cikli, ūdens tvaika un mitra gaisa īpašības, materiālu kaltēšanas, siltuma vadīšanas, brīvās un piespiedu konvekcijas, starošanas, kompleksās siltumapmaiņas procesi un siltumapmaiņas aparāti. Studenti iemācās risināt reālas inženiertehniskas problēmas termodinamikā un siltumtehnikā analītiski un izmantojot specializētas datorprogrammas (Comsol).
Teacher: Andris Martinovs

name: Franču valoda II (Valo3137)
content:
Izglītojamais apgūst vienkāršākās klausīšanās, lasīšanas, runāšanas un rakstīšanas prasmes, lai saprastu vienkāršus franču valodā runātus un rakstītus tekstus tagadnē, pagātnē un nākotnē, kā arī prastu pastāstīt par sevi un spētu orientēties frankofonā vidē.
Studējošais kursa noslēgumā spēj veidot vienkāršas teikuma konstrukcijas, veidot vienkāršus stāstījumus tagadnē, pagātnē un nākotnē, aprakstīt savu un apkārtējo cilvēku fizisko un emocionālo stāvokli, orientēties telpā, laikā un dažādās dzīves situācijās, rakstīt un saprast vienkāršus tekstus,veidot dialogu.

Vizuālās mākslas valoda un kompozīcija I (MākZ1085)
content:
Prasības studiju kursu apguves uzsākšanai: Kursa apguvei nepieciešamās priekšzināšanas atbilst studiju programmas uzņemšanas nosacījumiem un vispārējām zināšanām, prasmēm un kompetencēm, kas apgūtas iepriekšējā izglītības līmenī.
Kursa anotācija: kurss paredz studentus iepazīstināt ar vizuālās mākslas klasifikāciju, mākslinieciskajiem izteiksmes līdzekļiem, kompozīcijas uzbūves pamatprincipiem, veidiem un to pielietošanas iespējām. Iegūtās zināšanas ļaus izprast kompozīciju kā radošas izpausmes nozīmīgu sastāvdaļu dizainera profesijā. Studenti kursā iegūs prasmes un iemantos iemaņas praksē pielietot mākslinieciskos izteiksmes līdzekļus un kompozīcijas pamatprincipus, praktiski darbojoties attīstīs radošās spējas, uztveri un iztēli.
Kursa mērķis: teorētiski apgūt vizuālās mākslas valodas terminoloģiju, iepazīstoties ar dažādiem vizuālās mākslas veidiem un žanriem, attīstīt radošās spējas, uztveri un iztēli, praktiski apgūstot vispārējās kompozīcijas izteiksmes līdzekļus, pamatprincipus, veidus un spēju tos pielietot, risināt profesionālus uzdevumus mākslas un dizaina jomā.

Teacher: Diāna Apele

name: Photography and Graphic Design of Web Applications (DatZ3065)
faculty: Faculty of education, languages and design
content:
Course abstract: in the course, students gain an understanding of the technical and photographic parameters of the camera, learn skills in photography and puts skills into practice by performing practical tasks in photography, getting to know composition, light, colors in photography, photo perception in physiological and psychological aspects. As part of the course, photo genres will be introduced, image quality will be determined criteria, find an insight into the principles of numbers in photography. Students at the end of the course using acquired theoretical foundations and skills, able to solve professional issues for the development and implementation of visual projects. Acquired knowledge and skills in photography are necessary when working in environmental art.
Aim of the course:improve future interior or product designer competence to implement a meaningful understanding of camera technical and shooting parameters. To help students learn skills in photography, and to use the skills in practice by doing practicals tasks in photography, getting acquainted with composition, light, colors, digital in photography, photo perception in physiological and psychological aspects, with photo genres, clarifying the image quality criteria.

Teacher: Natalia Brokane

name: English I (Valo1034) - Programming engineer
faculty: Faculty of education, languages and design
content:
The aim of the study course is to raise students’ level of English language, improve their knowledge in the field of English grammar and stylistics, which enables students to use  academic writing style in their professional activities. Within the study course students learn profession-related terms, learn how to use these terms both in oral and written communication. Language skills are improved by reading and analysing various texts, by watching different video materials, by discussing issues topical in the field of information technology and by providing solutions to possible problem situations. Students enhance their writing, reading, speaking and listening skills, develop critical thinking and ability to justify their opinion in English in written and oral form. 
Teacher: Svetlana Iļjina
Teacher: Ilze Skromule

name: Fundamentals of ergonomics (SpoZ1021)
faculty: Faculty of education, languages and design
content:
Study the aim of the course is to provide the student with basic knowledge of ergonomics ensuring the working environment and understanding the social rehabilitator's health the need for gentle movements during client care. Within the course students acquire knowledge about the assessment of health and behavioral changes, professional self-defense mechanisms and hygiene requirements social in rehabilitation practice. Skills in the use of technical aids are acquired for the promotion of the client's independence according to the basic principles of ergonomics.
Students learns skills for working in a multi-professional team and is able to adapt rehabilitation process according to the basic principles of ergonomics.
Study the student needs to complete the course knowledge of human anatomy and physiology, health and environmental education, human with disabilities for psychological sociological issues.

name: Health Psychology
faculty: Faculty of education, languages and design
content:
The course develops knowledge in health psychology field, understanding psychological factors that influence health, and constructively applying that knowledge, learning to improve health by working directly with individual patients or indirectly in large-scale public health programs.
The main aim of the course: to study psychological and behavioral processes in health, illness, and healthcare, understanding psychological factors that influence health, and constructively applying that knowledge in practice.
Learning Outcomes:
Student is capable of analysing individual cases of behaviour change by providing complex integration of the possessed knowledge and drafting a plan of individual assistance.
Student is capable of finding, analysing, evaluating new academic literature on a topic in specific counseling problems and discussing with colleagues.
Student is capable of studying individually, finding out and critically evaluating professional knowledge and novelties.

name: Translation theory and methodology (Valo702)
faculty: Faculty of education, languages and design
content:
In the course students get an idea of translation theoretical frameworks, translation history and translation criticism. That's it differences between interpretation and translation are discussed types of written translation, methods, issues of professional ethics, contemporary use of technology. Realizing the theoretical question and the mutual one of practice interactions, students to a specific Lithuanian and Latvian language text bases learn translation practicals skills, as well as skills for evaluating translated text.
Teacher: Antra Kļavinska
